reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Oceanfront hotel for 3 nights and I found it to be a very pleasant experience. The hotel is kept spotlessly clean. The front desk people were curteous and helpful, and so were the valet attendants. We were upgraded to a very nice room with a balcony overlooking the beach. I enjoyed either sitting on the beach or walking the long boardwalk down to South Beach. You do have to pay 10,00 for a chair and another 10.00 for an umbrella, but that didn't bother me. you can walk up 41st Street to a few stores, banks or delis. I found the hotel to be perfect for a nice getaway in the Miami area at very resonable prices.
reviews.title: a very nice hotel

reviews.text: Spent 5 nights at the Courtyard Oceanfront and had a great time. The rates are very reasonable for oceanfront Miami Beach. We timed the walk to Lincoln Road in South Beach at 35 minutes. By bus It's a very easy 10 minute ride. (It seems that nobody middle class takes the bus in Miami but we thought it was fine and cheap at $1.50.) As an alternative to the not inspiring hotel breakfast buffet, Arthur Godfrey Rd (41st St) has a number of great and inexpensive cafes.
reviews.title: Rewarding Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First this review is on the Marriott 39th and collins ave..not to be confused. We stayed there in October..loved it again. Great location for walking or jogging on the boardwalk, great delis and french bakeries up 41st. And for those of you from MA a brand new Dunkin Donuts on 41st (three blocks) as well. For those on a budget, avoid the 35$ taxi ride and take the J bus..longer but only $1.50 a person from the airport (takes 50 minutes). The Carrabas restaurant was great, sit at the counter and watch the food being prepared. 20 minute walk to Deco District on the boardwalk. Got early check in and late check out without a hassle. Relaxing time!
reviews.title: Loved it the second time too

reviews.text: I stayed for 4 nights in the Courtyard in April for a conference. I was very pleased with the hotel. The room was big and clean, the staff was attentive and friendly. The pool is a great plus, large and well maintained. The hotel has also a nice al fresco bar, where we enjoyed our drinks in the evening, looking out on the beach. There is also an italian restaurant, but as we didn´t eat there I can´t really comment. The hotel is next to the boardwalk and the beach, so I was able to do my daily workout at the beach and straight afterwards jumped into the nice pool.
reviews.title: A very good experience

reviews.text: The only downside was that to all major attractions we needed a taxi as the hotel is located in the northern half of Miami Beach.
reviews.title: Overall great experience

reviews.text: We just got back from a week's stay the Courtyard. We had a great vacation there but the Hotel does need some tweaking. We loved the Carrabbas Grill and restaurant. The food was excellent. Watch out though, they tack on gratuity to everything, including a straight bar purchase.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.text: The pool was kept very clean and towels abundant. They freely gave them out and replaced wet ones. We took ours to the beach as well. The beach was gorgous and warm, salty water. It was a nice escape from the bustle of the pool area. We traveled with 2 kids (13 and 10) The Courtyard was lacking in "things to do for them" other than the pool. There is no game room, no pool tables, no vollyball etc. They really need to address this. We found the rooms to be clean but they didn't have them ready till around 5 pm each day. We loved being

reviews.text: Breakfast Buffet was very good with a nice variety of choices which included make your own waffles, eggs to order, fresh fruit, bacon, sausage, etc. (We had free breakfast coupons from Hotels.com) If no coupons, breakfast for two would run you $28 with 15% gratuity included.

reviews.text: Carrabba’s Restaurant and Beachside Grill, in our opinion was over priced and mediocre at best. There are other options within walking distance, such as Arnie & Richie’s on 41st Street for breakfast and lunch, Café Avanti ristorante italiano & bar also on 41st Street for wonderful dinners, and Hola Lola’s at 3500 Collins Ave for fabulous dinners.

reviews.text: The hotel pool was nice, however there were many families with unsupervised children running/swimming amuck. Pool was clean and fresh towels were abundant. Beach was awesome and ocean water was warm. There was some seaweed and left over fireworks from 4th of July. Beach chairs from the hotel cost $10 per day. If you wish, purchase your own from Walgreens or CVS (just over the bridge on 41st). The hotel also has a washer and dryer on the 3rd floors to wash beach towels. Workout room also available on 3rd floor.

reviews.text: This property is right on the beach front. Great view of the ccean. Parking is a problem, used the valet. The rental car that I had came back dirty, radio station changed and a ding in the windshield. Not sure what the valet did with the car while he had it, but I wasn't pleased with the valet service. They told me the vehicle would be safer in valet, but I'm not so sure. The restaurant onsite is very good. There is an outdoor and indoor restaurant and both were excellent. The outdoor looks out over the beach and ocean. What a great way to enjoy a meal! The beach is a short walk out the back of the property. They do lock the gates, so had to jump the gate one morning when I wanted to be on the beach at sunrise. Otherwise, would have to go out the front door and walk around the building. Did not use the pool, but it appeared to be nice. There was also some nice spots for sitting in the sun in the back of the property. I was there for just one night, so spent my free time on the beach. It was great! There is staff that sets up your chair and umbrella. Worth the $20.00 I paid. There were not many people along this portion of the beach and felt quite safe being out there. I did see some homeless people later in the evening, but they did not appear to bother anyone. There is a boardwalk going in either direction from the hotel, but no access to anything. There are also many homeless cats that people feed along the boardwalk. Kind of a quirky addition to the overall experience. The front desk staff was very nice. There is an elevator in the back of the hotel, so you do not have to utilize the elevator in the main entrance to go to the beach. Towels were available poolside. I quite enjoyed this hotel. The room was adequate and comfortable. My room overlooked the street, so nothing to write home about, but nothing to complain about either. Wish I could have stayed longer...
reviews.title: Loved the Ocean View

reviews.text: This was our first time in Miami/SoBe. I did a lot of research and fortunately trusted the reviews on Trip Advisor and booked the Courtyard. It was by far much more superior than we expected. The grounds were awesome, the Tiki bar was so beautiful and the Ocean front room we stayed in was priceless! Another neat plus was the boardwalk and the easy access to the beach. We had such a great time and the service was also very good. The only minor negative is that you need a car or taxi to get to SoBe/Ocean -- especially at night when you'll likely be wearing heels!
reviews.title: what a great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my wife stayed at the Marriot Courtyard on Collins Ave for 4 nights last week, we found the hotel to be good value!! the staff are very friendly guy called Alex, he will guide you to the local attractions, the hotel offers guides to the everglades and key west and other attractions at a affordable rate, i would strongly advise you to visit Sawgrass Mills Mall, they have over 350+ outlets from J Crew to Hugo Boss, JC Penny, Nike Factory stores, you will not be able to find any factory outlets in Miami Beach area. Saw grass mills is about 20miles from the Hotel, you can go by coach from the hotel which will cost you $20, well worth it. Aventure Mall is great the S bus will take you straight outside the mall, the hotel pool is great along side the tiki bar, the beach is beautiful but the sunbeds are abit costly $30 for 2 sunbeds, breakfast is great at £10 buffet, rooms are very clean never had to ring house keeping to clean the room. The Hotel mimi market is expencive, a bottle of water will cost you $2.75, you can walk to wallgreens around the corner and a case of 12 for $7, fridges are provided in the rooms. I am planning to go back next year again to the Marriot Courtyard Oceanfront Collins Ave. !! posted by Ripps Patel, UK
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My huband and I stayed at the Courtyard Oceanfront on Collins for 3 nights. Checkin was good. We were able to get into our 8th floor oceanview room by 12pm on Saturday. The room was a typical courtyard room but just a little smaller. We enjoyed the balcony with the great view. Overall the hotel is a great place to stay if you don't mind being away from the heart of south beach. It has a nice pool area with plenty of chairs, towels provided, a tiki bar with food and drinks and just a short walk across the boardwalk to the beach. It is almost like a mini resort! We did not have many kids at the pool when we were there, so it was peaceful. I would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!

reviews.text: South Beach, Miami is a fantastic place to visit. If you're young and single this hotel is the WRONG place to stay. It seems as though this hotel attracts families.
reviews.title: Courtyard Marriott, South Beach

reviews.text: My best friend and I stayed here for one night prior to our Norwegian Pearl cruise. We got to the hotel around 3:30pm and we were checked into our oceanfront/balcony room. It was fantastic. The room was very nice, the beds were super comfortable and the view was spectacular. The a/c was kicking. I am one to keep my place so cold, visitors freeze when they visit, and this place almost ran me out it was so efficient. Ships of all kinds rolling in and out of the ports. The Tiki bar was open with lots of people, music and a 2 for 1 happy hour. We had the beach in front of us, and the pool and jacuzzi behind us. There was a musician playing all kinds of popular tunes in reggae style. I had a mushroom and cheeseburger that was very very good. As for any noise from construction, there wasn't any. The buildings on either side were complete. Any work left that need to be done was interior. The breakfast was 13.00 pp, but it was my birthday so we decided to splurge a little. But for that, they had scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, cereals, fruits, danishes, an omlet station, and waffle station. Fresh squeezed oj, and really great coffee. It is about what any reasonable person would expect to pay being in Miami Beach. If you want the $5.00 breakfast, grab a $20.00 cab and find an IHOP! This place was perfect. The taxis charged a flat fee to the Port of Miami for $20.00. I didn't need a lot around me as far as restaurant choices, shopping, and clubs. We just wanted a nice reasonable place to stay pre-cruise and got so much more than we bargained for. Go for it!!!
reviews.title: Love Love Love

reviews.text: Stayed at the Marriott Oceanside for 3 days from 19-22 Oct with my husband and our two teenagers. Booked a quad room overlooking the ocean and the pool. When we arrived we received the added bonus of a balcony. Spotlessly clean with friendly housekeeping staff. Breakfast was excellent (by British standards and prices!) The Tiki beach bar/restaurant had a great atmosphere. Ok it's not on South Beach but it's only a $10 cab fare away or if not too hot a pleasant walk on the beachside boardwalk. No 3 star hotel in Britain would compare! Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Excellent 3 star hotel

reviews.text: I stayed with my husband and my children at the Courtyard in Miami Beach and enjoyed a lot. The hotel is clean and the room has a good space for a family. The greatest thing is that the hotel is on the beach and a quiet spot of it. The negative side of it is that the chair rental is awfully expensive - $ 10,00 a day. The swimming pool is regular. I don´t advise to pay for the breakfast, it is expensive for what it offers.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed 9/28-30 and had a terrific time. We are Marriott rewards people and have spent at least 50 nights this year in Marriott hotels and this experience is by far the best in many years. We've stayed in the super lux Marriotts and all of the brands in between, but the service here was wonderful. But what we noticed immediately? The cleaning staff - each one not only said Good morning as most staff do, but they also asked if we were enjoying our stay and took a moment to chat. We also thought it very nice that as we were leaving our floor, the cleaning person said it was a pleasure having us here and that she hopes to see us again. She will. The management was great too. We had a great view and the room we needed, all thanks to the Guest Relations Coordinator. I also liked the updates to the Art Deco hotel that still maintained its character and the location is great - just north of South Beach to avoid the traffic and noise and throngs of people, but close to walk (for us, might be a little too long for some who aren't used to longer walks) and a fairly inexpensive taxi ride. Bathroom was nice too - granite countertop with plenty of space.
reviews.title: Terrific experience

reviews.text: Just recently came from staying at the Courtyard Miami Beach Oceanfront and had a very lovely stay. I can't speak for check in because my boyfriend took care of that but he did mention that he had some problems with his card key but it was handled right away. The room is small but comfortable. The balcony is small but then again, I didn't go on vacation to hang out in my balcony. We did have a problem getting the air conditioner to work just right but that could have been my boyfriend's problem not really understanding it (and I didn't bother to check it out myself). We had lunch at the pool bar and received terrific service from Sal our waiter. He was very attentive and gave us alternative choices when we wanted a drink that wasn't available. It's great that the beach is right there but just know that you'll have to pay $10 per lounge chair which we gladly did for the couple of hours we were on the beach. We wanted to go to the pool but it was crowded so we opted for the beach.

reviews.text: Stayed at the Marriot for one night on the way back from South America. Our flight got in very early on Saturday morning, so we decided to head to the hotel to at least check our bags before check-in time. To our surprise they let us check in way before the required time, and we where very grateful for that. This was just the begining of exceptional service, a very helpful staff, and a super clean hotel. The room was a bit small, facing Collins ave. but you don't go to Miami to Stay in the room. The breakfast buffet was great, with a nice selection of fresh food. We did not eat at the resturant on the premises, so I can't comment on their food. the pool area is very nice and clean, and they actually have a deep end to the pool. Make sure to get there early though so you can claim a lounge chair. The beach across from the hotel is a nicer alternative, not too crowded, and swimmable. The only small issue I had was a mistake on charging my credit card for $118 which I noticed on my bank statement after I got home. It only took one phone call for them to remedy the situation. Overall, an excellent hotel, with a good location a few blocks away from South Beach. As a travel agent I would definately send my clients to the Marriot oceanfront.
reviews.title: great hotel by the beach

reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights in a spacious junior suite with two queen beds and enough open space for my two year old to have a play area.
